lowerCourt: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

wikiData.title: Brumfield v. Cain
wikiData.FullName: Kevan Brumfield v. Burl Cain, Warden
wikiData.Prior: Writ of habeas corpus granted, 854 [[F. Supp. 2d]] [https://www.leagle.com/decision/inadvfdco121108000129 366] ([[M.D. La.]] 2012); reversed, 744 [[F.3d]] [https://www.leagle.com/decision/infco20140228109 918] (5th Cir. 2014); [[Certiorari|cert]]. granted, 135 S. Ct. 752 (2014).
wikiData.Subsequent: On remand, 808 [[F.3d]] [https://www.leagle.com/decision/infco20151216123 1041] (5th Cir. 2015); cert. denied, 136 S. Ct. 2411 (2016).
wikiData.Holding: Because Brumfield satisfied §2254(d)(2)’s requirements, he was entitled to have his ''Atkins'' claim considered on the merits in federal court.
wikiData.JoinDissent: in all but Part 1-C by Roberts, Scalia, Alito
wikiData.LawsApplied: [[Eighth Amendment to the United States Constitution|U.S. Const. amend. VIII]]; {{USCSub|28|2254|d}}
